data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD Breakdown Levels Identified
data.text: Gold has broken below the longer-term ascending channel, pointing to continued selling despite short-lived geopolitical tensions providing a lift to the precious metal

data.title: EUR/USD: Steady as Investors Consider Hawkish Lagarde ahead of Powell's Speech
data.text: EUR/USD traders seek clarity as ECB signals another year of rate hikes, while Fed calls for only two more this year.

data.title: EUR/USD: Support at 1.0887 can maintain a slight upside bias with resistance seen at 1.0991/98 – Credit Suisse
data.text: Above support from the 55-Day Moving Average at 1.0887, EUR/USD can maintain a slight upside bias in the broader sideways range, analysts at Credit Suisse report.

data.title: XAU/USD: High Borrowing Cost to Continue Hurting Gold's Safe-Haven Appeal
data.text: Gold remains under pressure and probes through key Fibo support at $1909 (61.8% of $1804/$2080 rally) where the action was repeatedly rejected on Tuesday and Friday and hit the lowest in 3 ½ months.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD declines towards $1,900 as spotlight shifts to Fed Powell's speech
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) has challenged the crucial support of $1,910.00 in the London session. The precious metal is declining towards the psychological support of $1,900.00 as investors are expecting hawkish interest rate guidance from Federal Reserve (Fed) chair Jerome Powell.

data.title: EUR/USD to Remain Supported by Hawkish ECB as Sintra Meeting Heats Up
data.text: EUR/USD is likely to remain rangebound as Central Bankers share their thoughts at the ECB Forum. The tussle for superiority between bulls and bears looks set to rumble on.

data.title: EUR/USD Resumes And USD/JPY Could Extend Rally
data.text: On the hourly chart of EUR/USD at FXOpen, the pair started a fresh increase from the 1.0845 zone. The Euro climbed above the 1.0890 resistance zone against the US Dollar.

data.title: XAU/USD Grinds Support
data.text: The Canadian dollar softened after May's CPI came out of expectations. The pair remains under pressure with a series of lower lows demonstrating a growing downward pressure after it fell through 1.3250, with a bearish MA cross on the daily chart likely to attract bearish followers.

data.title: EUR/USD to remain strong if the Eurozone price data confirms the ECB's restrictive approach – Commerzbank
data.text: EUR/USD remains a little dull. Economists at Commerzbank analyze the pair's outlook.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: Struggling Near 3-Month Low Amid Strong US Economy, Rate Hike Anticipation
data.text: Gold prices capped as strong US data counters safe-haven appeal; traders anticipate rate hikes amid resilient economy, inflation concerns.

data.title: Intraday Analysis – Gold remains under
data.text: USDCAD attempts to bounce The Canadian dollar softened after May's CPI came out of expectations. The pair remains under pressure with a series of lower lows demonstrating a growing downward pressure after it fell through 1.3250, with a bearish MA cross on the daily chart likely to attract bearish followers.

data.title: Month-End Signals Suggest Buying Euro Vs US Dollar And Pound Sterling: Credit Agricole
data.text: Credit Agricole have released a final estimate of the month-end rebalancing model which calls for buying the Euro (EUR) against an equally-weighted basket of US Dollar (USD) and Pound Sterling (GBP).

data.title: Gold Futures: Near-term rebound in store
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted traders scaled back their open interest positions for the third session in a row on Tuesday, this time by around 2.3K contracts. Volume, instead, kept the choppy activity well in place and increased by around 33.5K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls seek acceptance from $1,935 and Fed Chair Powell – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold Price (XAU/USD) struggles to defend the corrective bounce ahead of the top-tier central bankers' speeches at the European Central Bank (ECB) Forum. Apart from the cautious mood ahead of the key event, mixed concerns about China, one of the world's biggest Gold customers, and firmer US data also test the XAU/USD traders.

data.title: EUR/USD is now seen within 1.0895-1.1010 – UOB
data.text: UOB Group's Economist Lee Sue Ann and Markets Strategist Quek Ser Leang note EUR/USD has now likely moved into a consolidative phase within 1.0895 and 1.1010.

data.title: EUR/USD drops as likely rate hikes from ECB propel fears of longer recession in Germany
data.text: The EUR/USD pair is displaying topsy-turvy moves around 1.0950 in the Asian session. The major currency pair is struggling to find direction as investors are awaiting the speech from Federal Reserve (Fed) chair Jerome Powell for further guidance on interest rates.

data.title: US Dollar Treads Water Ahead of Titanic ECB Gathering. Will EUR/USD Break the Range?
data.text: The Euro backed away from the overnight peak against the US Dollar as markets wait with bated breath for the ECB's much-anticipated gathering of central bank big guns. Where to for EUR/USD?

data.title: EUR/USD Bulls Need a Favorable Powell Speech to Retarget $1.10
data.text: It is a relatively quiet day ahead for the EUR/USD. While German stats will draw interest, The ECB's Lagarde and Lane and Fed Chair Powell will influence.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD trades with a mild positive bias, not out of the woods yet
data.text: Gold price edges higher during the Asian session on Wednesday and recovers a part of the previous day's losses, though the intraday uptick lacks bullish conviction. The XAU/USD currently trades around the $1,915 region and remains well within the striking distance of its lowest level since March 16 touched last Friday.

data.title: Gold Price Could Extend Losses Below $1,900
data.text: Gold price remained in a bearish zone below the $1,980 level against the US Dollar. The price traded below the $1,950 support to move into a short-term bearish zone.
